https://jira-software.status.atlassian.com/incidents/w6n74b64dwlm

h3. Environment
Server -> Cloud
Cloud -> Cloud

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Attachments are lost when migrating using the Confluence Cloud Migration Assistant from server to cloud.
h3. Environment

Confluence Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set up Confluence Server (5.10 to latest) with a production (i.e. non-H2) database
 # Set up a Space, create a page and attach multiple images to the page
 # Install the latest [Confluence Cloud Migration Assistant|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1219672/cloud-migration-assistant-for-confluence?hosting=server&tab=overview])
 # Create and run a new plan to migrate the new space, and no users
 # Wait for the plan to be successfully completed
 # Review the imported data in the cloud

h3. Expected Results

All images appear correctly
h3. Actual Results

Attachments are broken.

Images do not display. Attachments may give an error with
{noformat}
`Attachment File Not Found`

`The attachment you were trying to download could not be found in the attachment file store. Either the file has been deleted manually or there was an error in removing the record of the attachment from Confluence.`

`If this attachment is no longer required you can delete it from Confluence on the attachments page. Otherwise, you will need to attach a new copy.`

`<< Back to attachments page`
{noformat}
The below exception is thrown in the log file:
{noformat}
   message: Requested attachments not found in Filestore, so serving it locally. attachmentId: xxxxxxxx 
{noformat}
h3. Workaround:
 # Delete and reimport the space or
 # Use POST REST API call
{code:java}
 /wiki/rest/api/content/\{id}/child/attachment/\{attachmentId}/data {code}
as mentioned on [Confluence Cloud resti api documentation|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/rest/#api-content-id-child-attachment-attachmentId-data-post]

For the second workaround, please contact our support team at [https://support.atlassian.com/contact/] to export the broken attachments ID and name.
h3. Note:

This might be a recurring of https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/MIG-33
fields.summary: Attachments are missing after Confluence migration to the cloud, error message "Attachment File Not Found"

fields.description:
Currently a Jira data import (XML files) follows this flow. 

Upload File -> Process File -> Fix Any validation issues -> Import triggered. 

A task ID is generated only during the last stage in the above flow. 
It would be great that the task id was available right after the upload is complete so that the import can be resumed even if I close my browser window after the file is uploaded.
fields.summary: Change Jira Data Import Logic

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

After a Jira site import to the Cloud, the *Email Request* section, where you add your mailbox receive mails and create tickets, get a grey-out box for editing or disconnecting.

h3. Expected Results

You should be able to edit the mailbox or disconnect.

h3. Actual Results

The buttons to edit or disconnect are greyed-out, making it impossible to change the email address there.

h3. Workaround

Go to  https://yourcloudinstance.atlassian.net/secure/admin/SDMailInfo.jspa delete the mailbox go back to the project and re-connect.

h3. Notes

This is affecting any Jira SD migrations to the Cloud independent of the server version.
fields.summary: Editing mailbox for a Service Desk project after migration is not possible

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When importing Jira backup there is no option to not import users and groups, it would be good to have a menu option to not import users.

h3. Suggested Solution

Add a switch for importing users or not.

h3. Workaround

Remove the users and groups from the {{entitites.xml}} file.

{code}
sed -i '' '/<User id="/d' entities.xml
sed -i '' '/<Group id="/d' entities.xml
sed -i '' '/<Membership id="/d' entities.xml
{code}

*Note:* This workaround works most of the time, but each case needs to be assessed individually if you are having problems importing users, open a support ticket in our customer portal.
fields.summary: Have the option to not import users and groups

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When Cloud instances are on annual plan, triggering an import will validate the number of *active* users in the backup and compare with the number of license seats on the Cloud instance. If the number of active users is bigger than the number of license seats, it will fail the import validation.
* If an import is triggered with the *Overwrite users* option, it will compare the number of active users in the backup with the number of license seats.
* If an import is triggered with the *Merge users* option, it will compare the number of active users in the backup + the number of existing active users in the instance with the number license seats.

Although, the users can still be active without consuming license seats.

h3. Suggested Solution

Check for licensed users (users that are indeed consuming a license) instead of active users.

h3. Workaround

* If you will migrate with the *Overwrite users* option:
** You can manually deactivate some users in the backup(or in the source instance before generating the export) so that the number of active users is lower than the number of license seats that you have for the Cloud site. And then activate the users back through the UI once the site import has completed.

* If you will migrate with the *Merge users* option:
** If the number of existing active users in the Cloud site is already bigger than the number of license seats available, it will be necessary to initially deactivate some users in the instance, then change some users to inactive in the backup file making the number of active users in the backup + the number of active users in the instance to be lower than the number of license seats for the instance.

* You can deactivate the users in the entities.xml file, using the following sed command, it should work on mac, make sure there are a minimal amount of users active in the Cloud instance, otherwise, it will be necessary to deactivate those as well.
   
macOS

{code}
sed -i '' '/<User id="/s/active="1/active="0/' entities.xml
{code}

Linux

{code}
sed -i '/<User id="/s/active="1/active="0/' entities.xml
{code}

Windows

{code}
((Get-Content -path C:\Users\Administrator\Downloads\entities.xml -Raw) -replace 'active="1" createdDate=','active="0" createdDate=') | Set-Content -Path C:\Users\Administrator\Downloads\entities.xml
{code}
fields.summary: Improve import validation of licenses

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When performing Jira (XML) imports, attachments (media) data on the target Cloud site will be deleted in the process.
h3. Details

Performing test Jira imports are a common practice, so that we can anticipate any errors during the production migration. When the test Jira import is completed and everything has been verified to work correctly, we would then proceed with performing the production migration. For this, we would then need to perform the whole import process again, including the Attachment Import.

This Attachment Import process can take quite some time to complete, especially for large instances (with total attachment size of more than 100GBs).
h3. Suggestion

It would be great if we could have an option to retain those attachments after performing a test Jira import, so that we do not need to perform the Attachment Import again for the production migration. We would then only need to import any newer/delta attachments that have not been imported yet.

This would significantly reduce the total downtime that is needed during the production migration, as the majority of the attachments can be imported in advance.
fields.summary: When performing Jira imports, provide the ability to retain Attachments

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Migrating from Confluence Server to Cloud using Cloud Migration Assistant plugin is failing if a plan was already executed for a Cloud instance, and the instance's URL has changed after that.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In the plugin, create a Plan and run a migration to a Cloud site
# Change the URL of the Cloud instance
# When creating a new plan, select the new URL
# Try to proceed with the plan creation

h3. Expected Results
It should go through the plan creation and import.

h3. Actual Results
The plugin fails in the plan creation and the following error is thrown:
{code}
Cause
javax.persistence.PersistenceException: org.hibernate.exception.ConstraintViolationException: could not execute statement
    at org.hibernate.internal.ExceptionConverterImpl.convert(ExceptionConverterImpl.java:149)

caused by: org.hibernate.exception.ConstraintViolationException: could not execute statement
    at org.hibernate.exception.internal.SQLStateConversionDelegate.convert(SQLStateConversionDelegate.java:112)

caused by: org.postgresql.util.PSQLException: ERROR: duplicate key value violates unique constraint "mig_cloud_site_pkey" Detail: Key (cloudid)=(<cloud_id_hash>) already exists.
    at org.postgresql.core.v3.QueryExecutorImpl.receiveErrorResponse(QueryExecutorImpl.java:2476)
{code}
 
h3. Workaround
Reinstall the plugin following the page below:
- [Restore the Cloud Migration Assistant for Confluence to the default version|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/restore-the-cloud-migration-assistant-for-confluence-to-the-default-version-974378747.html]
fields.summary: Cloud Migration Assistant fails to create a plan, if a plan was already executed for a Cloud site and the site URL has changed

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Change the order of reindexing in Jira Site Imports

h3. Details
Currently the site reindex runs as a part of the site import process. The reindexing runs for a long time and extends the runtime for the import. 

h3. Suggestion
It would be great if the reindexing can be triggered after the import completion. 

h3. Workaround
Atlassian Cloud Support can manually make this change and have to trigger a reindex after the completion of import.
fields.summary: Change the order of reindexing in Jira Site Imports

fields.description:
h3. Summary

During a JIRA import, if the export is from a JIRA that has a pending upgrade task in the database, this entry is migrated and causes the JIRA Upgrade task (after the import) to fail and permanently Lock JIRA.

Existing JAC on import bug:  https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59868
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Upgrade Tasks may appear as "Pending" in the *upgradehistory* db table if the DelayedUpgradeJobRunner introduced in JIRA 6.4 delayed the task.
 # Export a JIRA that has a "Pending" task in the *upgradehistory* table.
 # Import to latest JIRA

h3. Expected Results

JIRA imports and runs upgrade tasks
h3. Actual Results

*Update: 7/7/2016* - JIRA will allow the export, but will raise a validation error before beginning to import the backup file. This should allow the workaround to be applied directly and the import restarted.

Under the previous behaviour JIRA imports data but fails to run upgrade tasks with the following error in the logs:
{noformat}

I found the following entry on the entities.xml
{noformat}
JIRA is locked.
h3. Notes

On that particular case the following entry is found in the "entities.xml"
{noformat}
<UpgradeHistory id="10639" upgradeclass="com.atlassian.jira.upgrade.tasks.UpgradeTask_Build64016" targetbuild="64016" status="pending"/>
{noformat}
The export was from a JIRA build 64016
h3. Workaround
 * Search for the UpgradeTask_Build number in the entities.xml
 * If it is in "Pending" status, remove the entry and any other "Pending" tasks.
 * Recover JIRA and import again
fields.summary: Validation check - Add in check to look for upgrade task "Pending" in the upgrade history

fields.description:
{{*Problem Definition*}}
{{We have seen a few cases where spaces fail to get imported to the Cloud, however, retrying those usually work}}

Also, have a retry button for Cloud Migration Assistant for Confluence, when a Space export fails, currently, we need to create a new plan and run for those spaces that have failed to get migrated, simpling adding a retry button would save a lot of time for customers migrating to Cloud.
h3. Suggested Solution

When a space fails, retry rerunning in the background automatically

Add a retry button for those spaces which failed to get migrated
h3. Workaround

Create a new plan and choose to migrate only those spaces that failed.
fields.summary: Automatically Retry and add a Retry button for failed space migrations using Cloud Assistant for Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When a user creates a backup on *22nd May 2019*, the backup stuck at "Compressing data & attachments" for days, even though the logs showed the import had failed at the backend.

h3. Expected Results
Jira shows error and allow the user to perform new export.

h3. Actual Results
Jira stuck forever with "Compressing data & attachments"
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
* Get another user to perform the backup
* Contact Atlassian Support to unlock the frozen bar for the user.
fields.summary: Backup stuck at "Compressing data & attachments"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When performing a full Jira site import or a Jira cloud migration assistant migration, any project shortcuts that have been added to a project on the Source do not get migrated to the destination instance and need to be recreated manually

h3. Environment
* Jira Server to Jira Cloud
* Jira Cloud to Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a project shortcut in a project on the Source instance
# Generate a full site backup of the Source instance or migrate a project with shortcuts through JCMA
# Restore backup generated to destination instance

h3. Expected Results
All project data is restored including project shortcuts that were added

h3. Actual Results
Project shortcuts are not in the destination instance

h3. Workaround
Project shortcuts will need to be manually recreated after the migration is completed
fields.summary: Jira site imports and Jira cloud migration assistant do not migrate project shortcuts

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When we import the spaces from Server to Cloud, the tiny links are not updated.
* The tiny links are generated based on the PageId after converting to byte array and encoded to base64.

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be nice if we can have a tool like "Jira Macro Repair" to update the tiny links on the pages. 

h3. Why this is important
Currently, there's no way to update the tiny links after the migration. The users will be redirected to the old instance when clicking on the links
 
h3. Workaround 
* Convert the links into standard links before the migration
fields.summary: It would be nice if we have a tool to update the tiny links after migration

fields.description:
As a user I wanted to notified after a Jira site import / JCMA plan or a Cloud Migration Assistant for Confluence plan has finished running.

Similarly in Confluence I want to be notified when a plan has completed running, Watching the screen to get updates seems to be a waste of time.
fields.summary: Send me a notification email after an import task has completed.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When adding "Administer Jira" permission to a non-admin default group on the source Jira, the import would fail on destination instance.
* Cloud's default admin groups are "site-admins", "administrators", "jira-administrators"

h3. Environment
* Tested with Server to Cloud migration

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# On the source Jira, go to *Jira settings > System > Global permissions*
# Add "jira-software-users" group or any custom group to "Administer Jira" permission
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
# Take the backup file
# Import the backup to Jira Cloud

h3. Expected Results
The import is done successfully.

h3. Actual Results
Import failed with error:
{code}
Error importing data: com.atlassian.jira.log.clean.PrivacySafeException: Privacy-safe boxing of a com.atlassian.crowd.exception.runtime.OperationFailedException
{code}
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

*Application logs:*
{code}
com.atlassian.crowd.exception.runtime.OperationFailedException: com.atlassian.idp.client.exceptions.AuthorizationException: {"schemas":["urn:ietf:params:scim:api:messages:2.0:Error"],"status":"403","detail":"Product access forbidden for Jira administration","errorType":"ProductAppAccessError","message":"Product access forbidden for Jira administration","data":"Jira administration"}
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.identity.DefaultIdpSafeOperations.handleAuthorizationError(DefaultIdpSafeOperations.java:196)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.identity.DefaultIdpSafeOperations.withRetry(DefaultIdpSafeOperations.java:177)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.identity.DefaultIdpSafeOperations.requestGroupAccessToProduct(DefaultIdpSafeOperations.java:130)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.identity.IdentityImportHelper.updatePermission(IdentityImportHelper.java:275)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.identity.IdentityImportHelper.updateGroupPermissions(IdentityImportHelper.java:257)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.identity.IdentityImportHelper.performMigration(IdentityImportHelper.java:156)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.CloudImportTaskRunner.performTasksOnImportDb(CloudImportTaskRunner.java:399)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.CloudImportTaskRunner.performTasksOnImportDb(CloudImportTaskRunner.java:488)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.CloudImportTaskRunner.lambda$null$1(CloudImportTaskRunner.java:223)
	at com.atlassian.connpool.impl.AbstractConnectionPoolProvider.withPrivatePool(AbstractConnectionPoolProvider.java:133)
	at com.atlassian.jira.connpool.JiraViburConnectionPoolProvider.withPrivatePool(JiraViburConnectionPoolProvider.java:137)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.AbstractBackupTaskRunner.lambda$null$0(AbstractBackupTaskRunner.java:63)
	at java.util.Optional.map(Optional.java:215)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.AbstractBackupTaskRunner.lambda$runWithSeparateContextAsync$1(AbstractBackupTaskRunner.java:62)
	at java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture$AsyncSupply.run(CompletableFuture.java:1590)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1149)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:624)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:748)
Caused by: com.atlassian.idp.client.exceptions.AuthorizationException: {"schemas":["urn:ietf:params:scim:api:messages:2.0:Error"],"status":"403","detail":"Product access forbidden for Jira administration","errorType":"ProductAppAccessError","message":"Product access forbidden for Jira administration","data":"Jira administration"}
	at com.atlassian.idp.client.IdentityPlatformClientImpl.mapStatusCodeException(IdentityPlatformClientImpl.java:667)
	at com.atlassian.idp.client.IdentityPlatformClientImpl.mapStatusCodeExceptionIgnoringResult(IdentityPlatformClientImpl.java:628)
	at com.atlassian.idp.client.IdentityPlatformClientImpl.makeRequestWithEntityBodyAndNoExpectedResponse(IdentityPlatformClientImpl.java:616)
	at com.atlassian.idp.client.IdentityPlatformClientImpl.requestGroupAccessToProduct(IdentityPlatformClientImpl.java:510)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.identity.DefaultIdpSafeOperations.lambda$requestGroupAccessToProduct$1(DefaultIdpSafeOperations.java:132)
	at com.atlassian.jira.util.retry.Retryer$Retriable.call(Retryer.java:80)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.identity.DefaultIdpSafeOperations.withRetry(DefaultIdpSafeOperations.java:172)
	... 16 more
{code}


h3.Workaround
Option 1:
# From source Jira, remove "jira-software-users" group or any custom group from "Administer Jira" permission.
# Generate a new backup

Option 2:
# Unzip the backup file
# Edit *entities.xml* and remove the line where "jira-software-users" group or any custom group is having "Administer Jira" permission.
Example:
{code}
<GlobalPermissionEntry id="10201" permission="ADMINISTER" group_id="jira-software-users"/>
{code}
# Save the change and zip the XML files
fields.summary: Jira Site Import Doesn't Work When "Administer Jira" Global Permission is Granted to Cloud's Non Admin Default Group

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Attachments > 5GB needs to be manually broken down to a size <5GB size. 
Also, large attachments takes longer to upload, impacting prod migration timelines

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Take an attachment that is 10GB in size and import into a Cloud instance

h3. Expected Results

Attachments are loaded into Cloud successfully
h3. Actual Results

Attachment import process times out
h3. Notes

Known issue, but  bigger customers migrating to Cloud, this has become a big friction point for customers

h3. Workaround

[https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloudkb/how-to-import-only-part-of-a-jira-export-into-jira-cloud-859461966.html]
fields.summary: Ability to upload large size attachments into a Cloud instance

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
There was an API change on bitbucket cloud and Jira server needed to upgrade the DVCS plugin. Jira Software 8.3 and above will contain the upgrade by default.
* [Upgrading the Jira DVCS connector plugin|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/upgrading-the-jira-dvcs-connector-plugin-967900869.html]

However, Jira Cloud fails to process the upgrade task during the import.

* Verified on  8.3.0

h3. Issue Summary
Re-linking a cloud site causes {{ConstraintViolationException}}

h3. Environment
* Latest Cloud Migration Assistant for Confluence (CMAC)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Link cloud site https://aaa.atlassian.net in CMAC and perform a test migration
# After some time https://aaa.atlassian.net expires and is removed
# Provision a new cloud site with the same name https://aaa.atlassian.net (cloudId is changed at this stage; it is basically a new site but with the same hostname)
# Re-link https://aaa.atlassian.net in CMAC

h3. Expected Results
Cloud site can be re-linked and migration can continue.

h3. Actual Results
The below exception is thrown in the {{atlassian-confluence.log}} file:

ationException: could not execute statement]

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

While importing comments through Jira CSV importer, if the user do the exists it does not create missing user and associates comments to the user that is performing CSV import

CSV importer would create users on-the-go when it fails to map the content to an existing user. This works for fields such as "Assignee" or "Reporter".

However, it has a different behavior when mapping Comments to users; the CSV importer somehow is not capable of creating users for this case (it can only map to existing users).

Ultimately, if the CSV importer cannot create the user *or* cannot map the user, the CSV importer will associate those content with the user who is performing the import.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Import Jira CSV file, make sure there are comments in the CSV file

h3. Expected Results

1. Comments are associated to the right user
h3. Actual Results

If user is not present, comment is associated to the user performing CSV import

The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file:
{noformat}
2019-06-24 20:40:32,323 WARN - Commenter named ron.shafii not found. Creating issue with currently logged in user instead
{noformat}
h3. Notes

Irreversible - we cannot associate comments to the correct user after it is associated to he user performing CSV import
h3. Workaround

Import users before content.

 

*Short Term solution:*

Throw a pop-up recommending to import users before content

 

*Long Term solution:*

Create user, if they are not present - similar behaviour as in  "Assignee" or "Reporter"
fields.summary: Importing comments through Jira CSV importer do not create missing users and associates comments to importer

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
After a site migration to another site, especially when merging two Cloud instances, admin would like to configure the DNS redirection to make sure all users are working on the new site.

h3. Suggested Solution
* Provide the ability to redirect users from the old site to new site

h3. Why this is important
* Some users may not aware of the migration and accessing the old site that had shut down
* Avoid users to work on the old site

h3. Workaround 
None
fields.summary: Ability to Set DNS redirection after the migration

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Right now if a user tries to migrate through the Cloud Migration Assistant for Confluence, and the tool is not in the latest version, a banner appears, suggesting to upgrade the tool. However, upgrading in the middle of the migration might break the plan.
h3. Suggested Solution

Do not display the banner or do not allow updates during the migration.

h3. Workaround
To avoid this problem, do not update the migration assistant while a migration is running.
fields.summary: Update assistant tool during a migration through Cloud Migration Assistant for Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If you have hardcoded links to attachments or pages and you migrate over to the Cloud those links will be broken.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Insert an attachment on a page.
# On the sidebar of the page, click on the three-dotted button select "Attachments" from the menu.
# Copy the link, it should be something like this for Cloud https://instance.atlassian.net/wiki/download/attachments/pageid/attachment_name?api=v2
# Paste on another page

h3. Expected Results

Links would be updated to the new URL and the page id's as well.

h3. Actual Results

The links will be broken still pointing to the old instance.

h3. Notes
* Right now, if the Base URL of Confluence is copied and pasted into the editor, Confluence will automatically converts it into a Relative URL. These links works fine after migration (/)
* Though, full Base URL of Confluence entered via *Insert* > *Link* > *Web Link* are not detected. These links can't be used after migration (x)
* This behavior currently affects any kind of Confluence migrations, site import, space import, and Cloud Migration Assistant. Since the page id's change, it's very difficult to map those to the new pages.

h3. Workaround

We don't have a fix for these links yet. Reach out to [our technical support team|https://support.atlassian.com/contact/] in order to review the format of the links on your site and confirm if one workaround is feasible for your case.
fields.summary: Detect and change the Full Base URL of Confluence in the body of pages

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When performing an import, Jira would show the following error during the validation process if a group contains empty whitespace at the beginning/ending on group name.
{code}
Leading or trailing whitespaces in following group names: <list-of-groups>
{code}

The whitespace could be added accidentally but admins can change the group name as Jira/Confluence Cloud doesn't have the ability to do so.

h3. Suggested Solution
Since Jira able to detect the whitespaces on the validation process, it would be nice it allows admins to update the group name like how Jira handles the duplicate email addresses.

h3. Workaround 
Edit the backup file to remove the whitespaces:
# Unzip the backup file
# Edit *entities.xml*
# Look for the groups, example:
{code}
<Group id="10206" groupName="jira-developers " lowerGroupName="jira-developers " active="1" local="0" createdDate="2019-03-07 03:46:37.552" updatedDate="2019-03-07 03:46:37.552" description="" lowerDescription="" type="GROUP" directoryId="1"/>
{code}
# Remove the whitespace and save the changes
# Zip the file

If you're on Linux environment, you can also run the following command to modify the group names:
{code}
sed -i 's/\"jira-developers \"/\"jira-developers\"/g' entities.xml
{code}
==> change jira-developers to the affected group name.
fields.summary: Improve how Jira Site Import handles the Leading or Trailing Whitespaces in Group Names

fields.description:

h3. Expected Results

h3. Notes

h3. Workaround
Try exporting the space as XML format and import it to Cloud. Note that this workaround doesn't include migrating user data
fields.summary: Space import using Cloud Migration Assistant fails with ConstraintViolationException for unq_aaid

fields.description:
{panel:title= Bug Fix Policy|titleBGColor=#e0efff}
(i)
At the moment, we can't set an ETA for the fix to be released, since there's a number of factors that determine how our product team prioritizes bugfixes.
 You can learn more by reading [Atlassian Cloud Bug Fixing Policy|https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/atlassian-cloud-bug-fixing-policy-206865884.html].
{panel}
h3. Issue Summary

The markup macro will be unavailable once you try using it with a page migrated from Confluence Server via [the CMAC|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/cloud-migration-assistant-for-confluence-959303217.html]. Then you cannot use the macro in any page on the same site.
h3. Environment

Verified with the environment below:
 * Confluence Server v6.13.5
 * Cloud Migration Assistant for Confluence v2.0.3

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page on Confluence Server
 # Migrate the space via CMAC
 # Edit the page on Confluence Cloud
 # Try using the markup several times

!jac-mark-up.png|thumbnail!
h3. Expected Results

You can use the markup in any page.
h3. Actual Results

When you use the markup, an error bellow occurs in the browser console:
{code:none}
SyntaxError: JSON.parse: unexpected character at line 1 column 1 of the JSON data
{code}
!jac-console-error.png|thumbnail!

After that, you cannot use the markup in any page on the same site except the pages created by [the new editor|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/confluence-editing-improvements-945107733.html].
h3. Workaround

None. Consider adding yourself as a watcher to be kept informed as to the state of the bug moving forward. With that way, if our development team updates the ticket, you'll be notified via email.

fields.description:
{panel:title=(i) Implementation of New Features Policy| borderStyle=| borderColor=| titleBGColor=#e0efff| bgColor=}
At the moment, we can't set an ETA for this feature to be released, since there's a number of factors that determine how our product team prioritizes new features.
You can learn more by reading [Implementation of New Features Policy|https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/implementation-of-new-features-policy-201294576.html].
{panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Currently the [Cloud Migration Assistant for Confluence|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/cloud-migration-assistant-for-confluence-973486571.html] only supports the data migration of spaces and users/groups.

Some users heavily use *favorites* (save for later) and they are keen to keep their pages in the Cloud site as well.

As favorites' migration is a long-awaited feature (CONFCLOUD-36348), it should be a great chance to support it within the Cloud Migration Assistant for Confluence.



h3. Suggested Solution

Create relationships for favorites via REST API.

* [GET|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/rest/#api-relation-relationName-from-sourceType-sourceKey-to-targetType-get]
* [PUT|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/rest/#api-relation-relationName-from-sourceType-sourceKey-to-targetType-targetKey-put]

h3. Workaround

None. Consider adding yourself as a watcher to be kept informed as to the state of this feature request moving forward. With that way, if our development team updates the ticket, you'll be notified via email.
fields.summary: Support favorites in Confluence migration assistant

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When performing a Jira import, the import process will add users to groups based on the data contained in the backup file. On the source Jira Server instance, if there is a user that was added to a restricted addon group such as "atlassian-addons", the Jira import will fail, as the operation is not allowed (the group is only intended for System add-on users, and normal users are not allowed to be added into it).
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # On a Jira Server instance, add any user to a group called "atlassian-addons".
 # Generate a Jira backup.
 # Import the backup into a Jira Cloud instance

h3. Expected Results

The import completes successfully.
h3. Actual Results

Import fails at the 90% mark, and we can see this error messages in the logs:
{code:java}
Could not add user test-user@gmail.com

com.atlassian.crowd.exception.runtime.OperationFailedException: com.atlassian.idp.client.exceptions.AuthorizationException: {"schemas":["urn:ietf:params:scim:api:messages:2.0:Error"],"status":"403","detail":"You do not have permission to modify the group atlassian-addons","errorType":"InsufficientPermissions","message":"You do not have permission to modify the group atlassian-addons","data":"atlassian-addons"}
{code}
h3. Notes
 - Ideally, the import should not fail due to this issue. Instead, the Jira import should "ignore" the import of the group memberships into these restricted groups, similar to how the importer ignores the import into the restricted "system-administrators" group.
 - There might also be other system addon groups besides the "atlassian-addons" group

h3. Workaround

On the source Jira Server, remove the user from the restricted addon group.
fields.summary: Jira Server to Cloud import fails if a user is added to a restricted addon group

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Migration from Server to Cloud failing when the Server instance is synced with AD.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Start a Jira Server instance
# Sync the Jira Server with Active Directory.
# Generate a backup of the Server instance.
# Import this backup to a Cloud instance.

h3. Expected Results
The import should finish successfully.

h3. Actual Results
The import fails and the following error is thrown in the logs:
{code}
Could not find a directory instance loader for directory <com.atlassian.crowd.directory.MicrosoftActiveDirectory>
{code}
 
OR

{code}
No value present
     stack: java.util.NoSuchElementException: No value present
	at java.util.Optional.get(Optional.java:135)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.manager.directory.DirectoryManagerGeneric.getActiveDirectory(DirectoryManagerGeneric.java:97)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.embedded.core.CrowdServiceImpl.getGroups(CrowdServiceImpl.java:244)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.embedded.core.FilteredCrowdServiceImpl.getGroups(FilteredCrowdServiceImpl.java:180)
	at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor295.invoke(Unknown Source)
{code}
h3. Workaround
The workaround for this issue is the same applied on this page:
* [Importing from JIRA Server application to JIRA Cloud application throws an Unsupported Crowd Directory Error|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/importing-from-jira-server-application-to-jira-cloud-application-throws-an-unsupported-crowd-directory-error-779160730.html]
{quote}
# Inside the JIRA backup file, there are two XML files. The file containing the AD server information is entities.xml. Search for whatever your AD server is called (in this case "Crowd Server") and the following line will be found:
{code}
<Directory id="10001" directoryName="ad.directory" lowerDirectoryName="ad.directory" createdDate="2018-06-15 14:51:04.532" updatedDate="2019-05-28 13:43:09.735" active="0" implementationClass="com.atlassian.crowd.directory.MicrosoftActiveDirectory" lowerImplementationClass="com.atlassian.crowd.directory.microsoftactivedirectory" type="CONNECTOR" position="0"/>
{code}
# Change active="1" to active="0" and save the file into the zip archive.
{quote}

You can use the following commands to do so: 
{code}
### Change all Directories in file to disabled and subsequently only update internal directory to active ###
sed -i '' '/<Directory id="/s/active="1/active="0/' entities.xml
sed -i '' '/<Directory id="1"/s/active="0/active="1/' entities.xml
{code}

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Attachments are lost when migrating using the CMAC from server to cloud.
h3. Environment

Confluence Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set up Confluence Server (5.10 to latest) with a production (i.e. non-H2) database
 # Set up a Space, create a page and attach multiple images to the page
 # Install the latest [Cloud Migration Assistant for Confluence|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1219672/cloud-migration-assistant-for-confluence?hosting=server&tab=overview])
 # Create and run a new plan to migrate the new space, and no users
 # Wait for the plan to be successfully completed
 # Review the imported data in the cloud

h3. Expected Results
All images appear correctly

h3. Actual Results
Attachments are broken. 

Images do not display. Attachments may give an error with
{noformat}
`Attachment File Not Found`

`The attachment you were trying to download could not be found in the attachment file store. Either the file has been deleted manually or there was an error in removing the record of the attachment from Confluence.`

`If this attachment is no longer required you can delete it from Confluence on the attachments page. Otherwise, you will need to attach a new copy.`

`<< Back to attachments page`
{noformat}

The below exception is thrown in the log file:
{noformat}
   message: Requested attachments not found in Filestore, so serving it locally. attachmentId: xxxxxxxx 
{noformat}

h3. Notes

The cases reported, affected only space migration that was done using the Confluence Migration Assist for Cloud app, if we use the "Import a Confluence Space" feature from the Adminstration section, the issue it is not reproducible.

If all the attachments are missing in a space, it is likely a different issue such as the export from an older, unsupported version of Confluence.

On Confluence Cloud the attachments that are missing can be identified with as having no {{propertyname = 'FILESTORE_ID'}} in the {{contentproperties}} table, but having other {{propertyname}} data such as {{FILESIZE}}.

One notable cause we've discovered is related to this issue
* [CONFSERVER\-27594: Deleting a Page does not Delete its Draft (fixed in Confluence Server 6.15.3, 6.15.4)|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-27594]

which has been fixed in Confluence 6.15.3 and above. If the attachments are attached to a page, and the page has drafts and is deleted, then the attachments are not necessarily deleted if they are referenced in the draft. If those attachments are then referenced on another page in another space then they won't migrate.

h3. Workaround

1. Clear the MIG_ATTACHMENT table prior to remigrating any spaces
2. Delete and re-import the affected space.

h3. Notes for  Support Engineers
If a customer reports this case, please provide for the developers
* A full Confluence [Support Zip|https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/create-a-support-zip-790796819.html]
* The *... > Storage Format* of a page from Confluence Server and Confluence Cloud 
* The URL of the Page in Confluence Server and in Confluence Cloud
* From Confluence Server the output of
{code:sql|title=Confluence Server}
select * from mig_attachments;

select * from mig_cloud_site;

select content.*, contentproperties.*, spaces.*, mig_attachment.*
from public.content
join public.contentproperties on content.contentid = contentproperties.contentid
join public.spaces on content.spaceid = spaces.spaceid
left outer join public.mig_attachment on content.contentid = mig_attachment.attachmentid
where content.contenttype = 'ATTACHMENT' and content.prevver is null
order by content.contentid desc;

select mig_step.planid, mig_step.starttime, mig_task.executionstatus, mig_step.steptype, mig_step.stepconfig, mig_task.spacekey from mig_step left join mig_task on mig_task.id = mig_step.taskid where steptype='CONFLUENCE_IMPORT';
{code}
* From Confluence Cloud the output of
{code:sql|title=Confluence Cloud}
select content.*, contentproperties.*, spaces.*
from content
join contentproperties on content.contentid = contentproperties.contentid
join public.spaces on content.spaceid = spaces.spaceid
where content.contenttype = 'ATTACHMENT' and content.prevver is null
order by content.contentid desc;
{code}
fields.summary: Attachments are missing after Confluence migration to the cloud, error message "Attachment File Not Found"

fields.description:
h3. Summary 

The Jira Server → Cloud import fails as the backup file contains a user that has an email address that our system flags as invalid.

h3. Steps to replicate
# Have a user in the backup file which Jira Cloud importer regards as invalid. 

h3. Expected Results
The Jira Cloud importer reports invalid users during the XML validation. 

h3. Actual Results.
The validation ignores these invalid users and the import is triggered. 
However, the import then errors out due to these invalid users. 

h3. Details
Error in the splunk logs.
{code}Object didn't pass validation for format email: <<invalid email here>>{code}

h3. Workaround
Remove / Fix the invalid users in the XML files and retrigger the import.
fields.summary: Users with invalid emails aren't detected during the validation phase.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
User content is mapped based on Username and not email address

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a user called *admin2* on your server instance (lets say this user has email xyz_user@atlassian.com)
 # Create some content with this user in the Server instance. 
 # Generate a backup on the server instance
 # Have a user in Cloud with the username *admin2* but with another email (lets say abc_user@atlassian.com)
# Perform a Jira site import on the site from the backup from Step 3. 
# Choose the option to merge users. 

h3. Expected Results
User Content for user xyz_user@atlassian.com is mapped from Server to Cloud based on email address.

h3. Actual Results
User Content for user xyz_user@atlassian.com is mapped from Server to Cloud based on username matching. So the content gets mapped to user with email abc_user@atlassian.com


h3. Workaround
Content will be mapped correctly if the usernames match in the Jira Server and Cloud instances.
fields.summary: Using non-destructive site import maps user content based on username and not email.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
This usually happens when merging Jira Cloud instances.

h3. Environment
 * Cloud Instance A - Jira + Confluence
 * Cloud Instance B - Jira only (or Jira + Confluence)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Take a backup of Jira A and Jira B
 # Perform the merging on Jira Server as per [How to merge two different Jira Cloud applications together|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-merge-two-different-jira-cloud-applications-together-779160767.html]
# Import the merged data to Jira A

h3. Expected Results
Import without error.

h3. Actual Results
Import failed when syncing the users 

The below exception is thrown in the Log file:
{noformat}
Too many rows found for query on User
	row1: [GenericEntity:User][lastName,User][lowerDisplayName,test user][displayName,Test User][lowerLastName,user][active,1][externalId,540434:46rrmkfw-3249-e33b-90mq-329zo4w5wfgh][updatedDate,2019-05-24 13:28:18.0][userName,test.user][lowerEmailAddress,test.user@abc.com][firstName,Test][emailAddress,test.user@abc.com][lowerUserName,test.user][createdDate,2017-02-02 13:12:06.0][credential,nopass][deletedExternally,null][localServiceDeskUser,null][directoryId,1][lowerFirstName,test][id,17900]
	row2: [GenericEntity:User][lastName,User][lowerDisplayName,test user][displayName,Test User][lowerLastName,user][active,0][externalId,540434:46rrmkfw-3249-e33b-90mq-329zo4w5wfgh][updatedDate,2019-05-27 08:42:02.0][userName,Test.User1][lowerEmailAddress,test.user@abc.com][firstName,Test][emailAddress,test.user@abc.com][lowerUserName,test.user1][createdDate,2018-11-30 13:55:17.0][credential,nopass][deletedExternally,null][localServiceDeskUser,null][directoryId,1][lowerFirstName,test][id,22290]	
{noformat}

h3. Notes
* On Jira Server, we usually update the email address of the duplicate users after merging the data
* However, this caused the misalignment where the Atlassian Account ID between the Jira Server (backup file) and Confluence

Example:
* Jira Server is having "test.user_duplicate@abc.com" with the "external_id" (Atlassian Account ID) 540434:46rrmkfw-3249-e33b-90mq-329zo4w5wfgh
* On Confluence (Instance A), the Atlassian Account ID (540434:46rrmkfw-3249-e33b-90mq-329zo4w5wfgh) is associated with "test.user@abc.com"
* So, the conflict happens when the same ID is pointing to 2 different email addresses

h3. Workaround
*Option A:*
Use "Merge user data from the export file with user data that already exists in your cloud site" to perform the import

*Option B:*
# Perform the import without users and groups memberships
# Contact Atlassian Support to import the users and group memberships after the import is done.
{panel:title=active-users.sql}
\copy (SELECT email_address AS email, user_name AS username, display_name as displayname FROM cwd_user where active='1') to '/tmp/active-users.csv' csv header
{panel}
{panel:title=inactive-users.sql}
\copy (SELECT email_address AS email, user_name AS username, display_name as displayname FROM cwd_user where active='0') to '/tmp/inactive-users.csv' csv header
{panel}
{panel:title=memberships.sql}
\copy (SELECT DISTINCT parent_name AS "Groupname", child_name AS "Username" FROM cwd_membership WHERE parent_name != 'system-administrators') to '/tmp/membership.csv' csv header
{panel}
fields.summary: "Too many rows found for query on User" on Jira Site Import

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If a Jira site export contains corrupted data it causes the complete site import to fail.

This problem manifests itself under various circumstances: (see internal notes in the first comment)
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Generate an export file from a jira instance (server or cloud)
 # edit the xml export file to create one piece of data to be "orphaned" (for example, remove a <project{quote}{quote} entity, but leave the <issues{quote}{quote})

h3. Expected Results

The import complete successfully. The orphaned entities are ignored.
h3. Actual Results

The import fails with an unhelpful error message such as
{noformat}
Please contact Atlassian support. org.postgresql.util.PSQLException: ERROR: column "issue" contains null values"
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Manually edit the XML export file to remove the orphaned entities.
fields.summary: Orphaned entities cause Jira Site import to fail

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If the Jira export file contains a user directory with an id of 10000, Jira Cloud will fail the import.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Step 1
Generate a jira export file which contains a directory with the ID 10000
 # Step 2
Trigger a Jira Cloud site import from that export file.

h3. Expected Results
The export completes successfully
h3. Actual Results
The export fails.

Exception in logs:
{noformat}
Caused by: org.postgresql.util.PSQLException: ERROR: duplicate key value violates unique constraint "pk_cwd_directory_operation"
  Detail: Key (directory_id, operation_type)=(10000, UPDATE_GROUP) already exists.
{noformat}

h3. Workaround

Edit the XML export file to set the directory to *inactive* by setting the "active" attribute to 0.  

From this

{noformat}
<Directory id="10000" directoryName="..." lowerDirectoryName=".." createdDate="..." updatedDate="..." active="1" implementationClass="..." lowerImplementationClass="..." type="..." position="..."/>
{noformat}

To this

{noformat}
<Directory id="10000" directoryName="..." lowerDirectoryName="..." createdDate="..." updatedDate="..." active="0" implementationClass="..." lowerImplementationClass="..." type="..." position="..."/>
{noformat}

Then retry the import.
fields.summary: Jira Site import fails if the export contains an external directory with an id of 10000

fields.description:
{panel:title=Update (7th of August 2019)|borderStyle=dashed|borderColor=#3c78b5|titleBGColor=#3c78b5|bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*The Cloud Migration Assistant for Confluence is +now available+ on Data Center.*

With the 2.1.1 release of the [Cloud Migration Assistant for Confluence|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1219672/cloud-migration-assistant-for-confluence?hosting=datacenter&tab=overview], you can run a Server to Cloud migration for Confluence from a Data Center instance.

Cheers!

Caterina - Atlassian Product Manager for Migrations
{panel}
h3. *Problem Definition*

The current version of the Cloud Migration Assistant for Confluence it is not supported for Confluence Data Center and this makes it very difficult for Data Center customers to migrate to Atlassian cloud.
h3. *Suggested Solution*

It will be great for customers to be able to use Cloud Migration Assistant for Confluence also for Data Center.
h3. *Workaround*

+Option 1:+
 # Upgrade the Data Center confluence version to 6.14 (or higher)
 # Manually export/import the spaces

+Option 2:+
 # Take a site backup and restore to save version Confluence Server (which should be 5.10.x or above)
 # Use Cloud Migration Assistant for Confluence on Confluence Server to migrate spaces to Cloud
fields.summary: Cloud Migration Assistant for Confluence support for Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When the email address contains leading or trailing whitespace, the validation pass on Migration Tool but failed on Cloud. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a user with leading or trailing whitespace
 # Attempt to import users and groups to Confluence Cloud

h3. Expected Results
Validation failed on Migration Tool and shown the list of users that need to be fixed.

h3. Actual Results
No error when creating the plan. However, the import failed when importing the users to Confluence Cloud.
* Email validation rules differ between MIgration Tool and Cloud's User Management

The below exception is thrown in the log file:
{noformat}
ERROR [Caesium-1-2] [agent.service.stepexecutor.ProgressTracker] error Step failed, message: An unexpected error occurred during step: Migrating users and groups. Error: MigrateUsersResource.migrate.migrateRequest.users[77].email: must be a well-formed email address
{noformat}

h3. Workaround
# Run the following SQL query to check if any email address contains a whitespace:
{code}
select user_name,email_address from cwd_user where email_address like '% % or lower_email_address like '% %'';
{code}
# Access User Management on Confluence Server, update the email address without the whitespace
fields.summary: Failed to Import the Users and Group when the email address contains leading or trailing whitespace

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When we link Jira Service Desk to a Confluence Space as a Knowledge Base there are two options for setting user permissions
 # All active users and customers can access the knowledge base without a Confluence license.
 # Only licensed users who have access to the space

In order for this to work, we link Confluence to Jira as a *User Directory*, and the _customers_ in Jira are imported into Confluence as Unlicensed Users. They are in the {{cwd_user}} table but have no groups and no *Can Use* permissions.

The Confluence Server does not have Anonymous Access, but the Space does. This allows Jira Service Desk to return Confluence pages as search results when entering a ticket as a _customer_.

When we use CMAC to export from Confluence Server to Confluence Cloud, we send all the users and groups. As the _customers_ are not in any groups, they don't have any permission to use Confluence Cloud however they are migrated.
h3. Environment
 * Jira Service Desk linked to Confluence Server with a Knowledge Base with customer access with this setting

!jsd1.png!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set up Jira Service Desk
 # Set up Confluence
 # Link Jira Service Desk to Confluence as a Knowledge Base as documented
 ** [Set up a knowledge base for self-service|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskserver/set-up-a-knowledge-base-for-self-service-956713310.html]
 # Migrate Confluence Server using CMAC

h3. Expected Results

Only users with *Can Use* or mapped to a Group are imported into Confluence Cloud
h3. Actual Results

All Unlicensed Users are imported into Confluence Cloud
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Unlicensed Users are migrated to Confluence Cloud

h3. Issue Summary

When using a JNDI connector in Confluence, the Cloud Migration Assistant for Confluence (CMAC) throws {{com.atlassian.migration.agent.store.tx.TransactionException: Unable to propagate readonly transaction to write mode}}
h3. Environment
 * Confluence Server
 * JNDI database connection in {{server.xml}}
 * CMAC 1.0.9

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set up Confluence Server with a JNDI connector in {{server.xml}}
 # Create and run a plan in CMAC

h3. Expected Results

CMAC runs without error.
h3. Actual Results

In {{atlassian-confluence.log}} we get
{code:java|title=atlassian-confluence.log}
2019-03-14 13:59:09,163 ERROR [Caesium-1-2] [agent.service.stepexecutor.ProgressTracker] error Step failed, message: An unexpected error occurred during step:
 Migrating attachments. Error: Unable to propagate readonly transaction to write mode
 -- planName: MIG-10 v1 | taskName: Migrate space q1552532275084 | cloudUrl: https://mycompany.atlassian.net | referer: http://confluence.mycompany.com/confluence/setup/setupadministrator.action | cloudId: 33037903-356b-4902-801b-6ba7e0b48e89 | action: finishsetup | url: /confluence/setup/

-4f44-aa72-46a2d5d929aa | stepConfig: q1552532275084 | stepType: ATTACHMENT_UPLOAD | traceId: 8b043de50ad13218
com.atlassian.migration.agent.store.tx.TransactionException: Unable to propagate readonly transaction to write mode
        at com.atlassian.migration.agent.store.jpa.impl.DefaultPluginTransactionTemplate.on(DefaultPluginTransactionTemplate.java:36)
        at com.atlassian.migration.agent.store.tx.PluginTransactionTemplate.write(PluginTransactionTemplate.java:24)
        at com.atlassian.migration.agent.service.impl.DefaultAttachmentService.deleteAttachmentMigrationTrackingByCloudSite(DefaultAttachmentService.java:89)
        at com.atlassian.migration.agent.service.stepexecutor.attachment.AttachmentMigrationExecutor.lambda$validateAndUpdateMediaClientId$10(AttachmentMigrat
ionExecutor.java:303)
        at com.atlassian.migration.agent.store.jpa.impl.DefaultPluginTransactionTemplate.on(DefaultPluginTransactionTemplate.java:51)
        at com.atlassian.migration.agent.store.tx.PluginTransactionTemplate.write(PluginTransactionTemplate.java:24)
        at com.atlassian.migration.agent.service.stepexecutor.attachment.AttachmentMigrationExecutor.validateAndUpdateMediaClientId(AttachmentMigrationExecuto
r.java:293)
        at com.atlassian.migration.agent.service.stepexecutor.attachment.AttachmentMigrationExecutor.doAttachmentMigration(AttachmentMigrationExecutor.java:187)
        at com.atlassian.migration.agent.service.stepexecutor.attachment.AttachmentMigrationExecutor.lambda$runJob$2(AttachmentMigrationExecutor.java:181)
        at com.atlassian.migration.agent.service.stepexecutor.StepSchedulerService.lambda$runStep$1(StepSchedulerService.java:179)
        at com.atlassian.migration.agent.service.stepexecutor.StepSchedulerService.lambda$runStep$4(StepSchedulerService.java:199)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.util.logging.LoggingContext.executeWithContext(LoggingContext.java:146)
        at com.atlassian.migration.agent.logging.LoggingContextBuilder.execute(LoggingContextBuilder.java:109)
        at com.atlassian.migration.agent.service.stepexecutor.StepSchedulerService.runStep(StepSchedulerService.java:197)

        at com.atlassian.migration.agent.service.stepexecutor.attachment.AttachmentMigrationExecutor.runJob(AttachmentMigrationExecutor.java:181)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.impl.schedule.caesium.JobRunnerWrapper.doRunJob(JobRunnerWrapper.java:120)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.impl.schedule.caesium.JobRunnerWrapper.lambda$runJob$0(JobRunnerWrapper.java:91)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.impl.vcache.VCacheRequestContextManager.doInRequestContextInternal(VCacheRequestContextManager.java:87)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.impl.vcache.VCacheRequestContextManager.doInRequestContext(VCacheRequestContextManager.java:71)

        at com.atlassian.scheduler.core.JobLauncher.launch(JobLauncher.java:97)

For example, for PostgreSQL remove
{code:java|title=confluence.cfg.xml}
<property name="hibernate.connection.datasource">java:comp/env/jdbc/confluence</property>{code}
and replace with
{code:java|title=confluence.cfg.xml}
<property name="hibernate.c3p0.acquire_increment">1</property>
<property name="hibernate.c3p0.idle_test_period">100</property>
<property name="hibernate.c3p0.max_size">60</property>
<property name="hibernate.c3p0.max_statements">0</property>
<property name="hibernate.c3p0.min_size">20</property>
<property name="hibernate.c3p0.preferredTestQuery">select 1</property>
<property name="hibernate.c3p0.timeout">30</property>
<property name="hibernate.connection.driver_class">org.postgresql.Driver</property>
<property name="hibernate.connection.isolation">2</property>
<property name="hibernate.connection.password">password</property>
<property name="hibernate.connection.url">jdbc:postgresql://localhost:5432/confluence</property>
<property name="hibernate.connection.username">username</property>
{code}
*Change to match your environment:*
 * {{hibernate.connection.password}}
 * {{hibernate.connection.username}}
 * {{hibernate.connection.url}}

and restart Confluence.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Sometimes the target Confluence application might already have existing data and consequently an existing space with the same space key that we would like to migrate/import, in which case the space import would fail saying the space key already exists.
h3. Suggested Solution
Add the ability to change the space key during the plan configuration.
h3. Why this is important

*Scenario 1*:
The known workaround is to manually edit the XML files and search/replace the old space key with a new space key, which is an error prone task and might lead to subsequent parsing errors if the XML is not edited properly. And this manual step needs to be done "the old way" outside the scope of the Migration Assistant plugin by manually exporting the space to XML, changing the files and manually importing the space.

*Scenario 2*:
Confluence Server can contain any invalid (i.e., non-alphanumeric) space-key. In that case, CCMA better have a validation function and offer the ability to change space-key.

h3. Workaround 
https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-copy-or-rename-a-space-in-confluence-169578.html
fields.summary: Add ability to change space key

*Workaround:*
Try again in 30 minutes. If they still do not show, please contact support.

fields.description:
h2. *Summary of Issue*

Unable to enable the _Cloud Migration Assistant for Confluence app_ when Confluence is integrated with My SQL 5.6.

h2. *How to reproduce*

# Install Confluence 5.10.8 against My SQL 5.6
# Install the Cloud Migration Assistant app through Manage Add-ons and upload it using the URL from https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1219672/cloud-migration-assistant-for-confluence
# The add-on will fail to start
#* Checking {{atlassian-confluence.log}} shows:
{code}
Caused by: liquibase.exception.DatabaseException: Specified key was too long; max key length is 767 bytes [Failed SQL: CREATE TABLE confluence.MIG_CLOUD_SITE (cloudId VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL, cloudUrl VARCHAR(1024) NOT NULL, containerToken VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL, isFailing BIT(1) NULL, CONSTRAINT PK_MIG_CLOUD_SITE PRIMARY KEY (cloudId), UNIQUE (cloudUrl), UNIQUE (containerToken))]
	at liquibase.executor.jvm.JdbcExecutor$ExecuteStatementCallback.doInStatement(JdbcExecutor.java:356)
	at liquibase.executor.jvm.JdbcExecutor.execute(JdbcExecutor.java:57)
	at liquibase.executor.jvm.JdbcExecutor.execute(JdbcExecutor.java:125)
	at liquibase.database.AbstractJdbcDatabase.execute(AbstractJdbcDatabase.java:1229)
	at liquibase.database.AbstractJdbcDatabase.executeStatements(AbstractJdbcDatabase.java:1211)
	at liquibase.changelog.ChangeSet.execute(ChangeSet.java:600)
	... 88 more
Caused by: com.mysql.jdbc.exceptions.jdbc4.MySQLSyntaxErrorException: Specified key was too long; max key length is 767 bytes
	at sun.reflect.NativeConstructorAccessorImpl.newInstance0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeConstructorAccessorImpl.newInstance(NativeConstructorAccessorImpl.java:62)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingConstructorAccessorImpl.newInstance(DelegatingConstructorAccessorImpl.java:45)
	at java.lang.reflect.Constructor.newInstance(Constructor.java:423)
	at com.mysql.jdbc.Util.handleNewInstance(Util.java:406)
	at com.mysql.jdbc.Util.getInstance(Util.java:381)
	at com.mysql.jdbc.SQLError.createSQLException(SQLError.java:1051)
	at com.mysql.jdbc.MysqlIO.checkErrorPacket(MysqlIO.java:3563)
	at com.mysql.jdbc.MysqlIO.checkErrorPacket(MysqlIO.java:3495)
	at com.mysql.jdbc.MysqlIO.sendCommand(MysqlIO.java:1959)
	at com.mysql.jdbc.MysqlIO.sqlQueryDirect(MysqlIO.java:2113)
	at com.mysql.jdbc.ConnectionImpl.execSQL(ConnectionImpl.java:2687)
	at com.mysql.jdbc.ConnectionImpl.execSQL(ConnectionImpl.java:2616)
	at com.mysql.jdbc.StatementImpl.execute(StatementImpl.java:782)
	at com.mysql.jdbc.StatementImpl.execute(StatementImpl.java:625)
	at com.mchange.v2.c3p0.impl.NewProxyStatement.execute(NewProxyStatement.java:75)
	at liquibase.executor.jvm.JdbcExecutor$ExecuteStatementCallback.doInStatement(JdbcExecutor.java:352)
	... 93 more
{code}

h2. *Expected Result*

The add-on should have enabled successfully without any errors.

h2. *Actual Result*

The above stack trace is thrown and the add-on is not enabled.

h2. *Cause*

It appears that only after MySQL 5.7, MySQL increased the key length limit of 767 to higher values in MySQL 5.7.

* https://stackoverflow.com/questions/1814532/1071-specified-key-was-too-long-max-key-length-is-767-bytes
{quote}
767 bytes is the stated prefix limitation for InnoDB tables in MySQL version 5.6 (and prior versions). It's 1,000 bytes long for MyISAM tables. In MySQL version 5.7 and upwards this limit has been increased to 3072 bytes.
{quote}

h2. *Work around*

Temporarily migrate the Confluence database from MySQL 5.6 to MySQL 5.7 and try re-installing the add-on.

If you do not wish to upgrade MySQL, you can instead open a support request with us, and we will be able to provide you an early release of the patched version of the plugin which will work on MySQL 5.6.

It may also be necessary to drop these MIG tables (only if they exist and the add-on is disabled) before you can re-enable the _Cloud Migration Assistant for Confluence app_:

{code}
drop table MIG_ATTACHMENT;
drop table MIG_CLOUD_SITE;
drop table MIG_DB_CHANGELOG;
drop table MIG_DB_CHANGELOG_LOCK;
drop table MIG_PLAN;
drop table MIG_SEQUENCES;
drop table MIG_STATS;
drop table MIG_STEP;
drop table MIG_TASK;
drop table MIG_WORK_ITEM;
{code}
fields.summary: Cloud Migration Assistant for Confluence requires at least MySQL 5.7
