fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Move issues across business board columns throws an error if the user doesn't have Schedule issues permission
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Grant schedule issues permission to a user/group (don't leave any logged-in users)
 # Grant view, edit, transition issues permission to a different user
 # This last user can move issues across the board
 # An error is thrown because the issue cannot be re-ranked
 # As per Jira SW documentation Ranking issues requires schedule issue permission

h3. Expected Results

The issue should be transitioned without errors
h3. Actual Results

!image-2021-12-13-20-29-11-214.png!
h3. Workaround

Provide the schedule issue permission to the user (there is no workaround to avoid granting the permission to the user for now)
fields.summary: Move issues across business board columns throws an error if the user doesn't have Schedule issues permission

fields.description: Currently, custom fields can only be created a the tenant level.  It would be great, especially in JWM if we could create them in the context of a single project.
fields.summary: Ability to create custom fields local to a JWM project

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
- Business (Company-managed) project In list view fields that are *Single-Select* type do not scroll and extend past the screen. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open a Business project. 
# Go to *List*
# Click on an issue lower on the list.
# Change a field that is type *Single-Select*.
# Options will extend past the window and you cannot scroll. 


h3. Expected Results
List should be scrollable.

h3. Actual Results
Options extend past the window and you cannot scroll. 
 !image-2021-12-02-17-22-55-034.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Adjust the field directly in the issue.
fields.summary: Business project List : Single select field does not scroll

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When viewing a list in Jira Work Management, you can apply filters (e.g. labels) to display specific issues.

When doing so, the list will not display issue hierarchy. For example, applying a filter by label will make the parent/Sub-task relation disappear from the list. 

See the recording:   [^List filter behaviour.mp4] 
* In that case, JWKP-8 is a Sub-task of JWKP-6
* When I apply the filter, the Sub-tasks are displayed out of their parents (different from the default view where they appear under the parent issues)

h3. Suggestion

Have the list display the results with the parent/child hierarchy.
fields.summary: Have the list keep displaying parent/child relation when applying filter

fields.description:
I usually like to put the name of an author and the date of an email to the Ticket summary. There are suggestions by Jira to use the subject etc.

It would be nice to be able to select a kind of query for sugestions of subject, name and e-mail received date. 

!image-2021-11-23-15-35-07-036.png!
fields.summary: Email to issue creation: suggest Date and name of author/from

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Field of group type, when added to a form does not work 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a group field type(either single or multi)
# Add this field to the proper screens
# Access the form link

h3. Expected Results
As long as the user has "browse user and groups" permission they should be able to look by their own groups.

h3. Actual Results
User is not able to find any groups.
 !group.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Field of group type when added to a form does not work

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

For Business Projects when viewing a project on 'list' view , the original estimate column isn't showing any information. But the tasks contain information in the actuals fields for original estimate and time remaining.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
#  Create Business Project with some issues in it.
#  Make sure there is Original Estimate value for issues.
#  Navigate to "List" on the left menu
#  Observe Original Estimate is empty

h3. Expected Results

Original Estimate should show actual estimates

h3. Actual Results

Original Estimate is empty in List view

h3. Workaround

View original estimates on detailed issue view
fields.summary: Real time updates to Original Estimate in "List" view are not supported

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The columns selected to be shown in the JWM List view are removed (only defaults are left) after the session is restored (time has passed, private mode, using another device, using another web browser)
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access the List view from a business project
 # Add more columns to be shown
 # Recreate the session(time has passed, private mode, using another device, using another web browser)
 # Added columns are lost

h3. Expected Results

The column configuration should be preserved even after the session is restored
h3. Actual Results

Added columns are removed
h3. Workaround

Create a filter
[Saving a search as a filter|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-work-management/docs/save-your-search-as-a-filter/#Savingyoursearchasafilter-saving]

[Add, edit, or delete a shortcut|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-work-management/docs/add-edit-or-delete-a-shortcut/]
fields.summary: Column configuration in JWM List view is lost after session is restored

fields.description:
Currently, only issues updated on the last 14 days are visible on the Done column.

We would like to have the possibility to manually change this value.
fields.summary: Ability to change the number of days an issue will be visible on the Done column

fields.description: Currently only the due date is shown.
fields.summary: Show priority icon in the board

fields.description: Or the ability to set your own filters
fields.summary: Hide Epics from boards

fields.description:
One feature that notion has for tracking activity based on actions is entering +*@today*+ as a time stamp.

It would be really helpful to have date-based time tamps on comments or description of tasks. 

I found a twitter feed that shows how it is helpful:

[useful link for understanding use of @today |https://twitter.com/notionhq/status/1011339549748785152]
fields.summary: implement notions @today for date tracking

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In a JWM business project, when creating issues from JWM list view or while submitting a JWM form, the issue is not being assigned to the default assignee

Default assignee is set if the issues are created from the global "Create" button or from the JWM board. However, it is not working as expected in JWM list view and JWM forms.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a JWM project
 # Set default assignee as Project lead from Project settings
 # Create an issue via JWM forms or JWM list page

h3. Expected Results
If default assignee is configured in the project, the created issue should be assigned to the default assignee

h3. Actual Results
If the issue is created from JWM list view or JWM forms, the issue is not assigned to the default assignee.

h3. Workaround
Use automation for Jira to ensure that the issue is assigned to the default assignee when an issue is created in the JWM project.
fields.summary: When creating issues from JWM list view or JWM forms, the issue is not being assigned to the default assignee

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary



When the customer adds the Custom MultiLine Text field to a FORM whose renderer is set to WIKI style. When Previewing the form the WIKI style MultiLine text field shows up as a normal field. However, the system field *Description* is shown as WIKI style when set to WIKI renderer.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # We need a JWM Business project.
 # Create a Multiline Text CustomField and make sure the renderer is set to "WiKi Style" in the field configuration.
 # Create a FORM and add the field Summary, Description (Wiki Style), Multiline Text CustomField (Wiki Style).
 # Preview the FORM.

h3. Expected Results

* The JWM Issue FORM should render the Custom Multiline Text Field with formatting options when set to "WiKi Style Renderer". Just like the system field "Description" in the JIRA FORMs.

h3. Actual Results

* I created a field which is Multiline TextField with Renderer as Wiki Style Renderer for a JWM project. However, when adding this field to form and previewing it in the form view, the field shows up as a normal multiline text field. However, the Description field that is also configured to be a WiKi Style Renderer shows the options to format text.
* This is reproducible in the lab and even in the customer environment.
 !image-2021-10-28-13-07-50-466.png|thumbnail! 
 !image-2021-10-28-13-08-20-174.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Workaround

No workaround is available yet. If a workaround is found the ticket will be updated.
fields.summary: Previewing a JWM/Business Project FORM, custom multiLine Text field doesn't respect the renderer set in the field configuration.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Very recently, observed that the issues created in JWM projects were jumbled in timeline view. It is either not sorting in the order of issue ID or start/due date. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an issue in JWM project 
 # You will notice that in timeline view the recently created issue will be somewhere in the list of issues and not either at the last or the first.

h3. Expected Results

The issue key created recently should be at the last in the order of the issue key value
h3. Actual Results

[^2021-10-22_19-52-32.mp4]
h3. Workaround


 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: [Timeline] Sticky issue create component puts new issue in a wrong position

fields.description:
h3. Current scenario
If you have a recurring need to apply a filter with multiple values, you must manually select them every time.


h3. Desired fix
I want to choose a Saved filter or type a JQL to add to the default "Quick Filters" list, just like we can do to a Board "Quick Filters" in a Software project. This should apply to the board, calendar and timeline.
fields.summary: Ability to save custom quick filters

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

JWM Business board status column ordering fails if there is an unpublished workflow.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Edit a workflow, do not publish it or discard it.
 # Move the In-progress status on the board.
 # It will fail with a message - Failed to move column. Check your internet connection, then give it another try.
 # Edit a workflow, publish, or discard the draft.
 # Moving the In-progress status on the board works now as expected.

h3. Expected Results

Moving the In-progress status on the board changes positions as expected.
h3. Actual Results

Moving the In-progress status on the board will fail with a message - Failed to move column. Check your internet connection, then give it another try.
h3. Workaround

Edit a workflow, publish, or discard the draft.

Moving the In-progress status on the board works now as expected.
fields.summary: Business board status column ordering fails if there is an unpublished workflow

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61847].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Currently in JIRA Core there is no Releases / Versions Tab in the sidebar as in Software projects. 
Earlier there used to be a version tab in the side bar which is a quick link to *Project Settings* > *Versions*

h3. Suggested Solution
Add a Releases / Versions tab for Business projects in the sidebar 
 
h3. Workaround 
Change the project to a JIRA Software project.
fields.summary: Add Releases / Versions Tab in the sidebar in Business Projects

fields.description:
h3. Summary

At the moment, when due date or a custom date field is added to JWM form builder, the form displays the date with an example format.
The example date format sometimes causes confusion to users that the field is pre-populated by default.
h3. Suggestion

It would be great to add the ability for administrators to disable the example date format or customise the default date format example that is displayed on the JWM forms.
fields.summary: Ability to turn off or customize the default example format for date fields in JWM forms

fields.description:
Currently, we have support for multiple workflows for different issue types however, currently, it picks the first workflow mapped in the scheme and ignores the other.

As a result of this, only statuses of that mapped workflow can be visible on the board. For issues belonging to other statuses, we must check these issues under "List" or "Issues". In order to change the statuses of these issues, it must be done from the issue details view by selecting the workflow from the dropdown.
fields.summary: Support JWM board to display all the statuses from multiple workflows

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Currently drag and drop of parent and child issues is not possible. It would be great to have such feature to easily drag and drop the parents of our choice so that we can view them in the way we would like to see the issues.
fields.summary: Ability to drag and drop issues in timeline view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
On a business project, on 'List', if there are custom fields added as columns on the list, the column cannot be rearranged correctly.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add some custom fields to the screen of a business project.
 # Go to 'List' and set the columns to show the custom fields added in step 1.
 # Drag the columns to rearrange the columns on the list.

h3. Expected Results
The columns will able to be dragged and rearranged correctly.

h3. Actual Results

When dragging a column heading to another position, either nothing happens, or all columns rearrange to weird positions.

 [^Screen Recording 2021-10-15 at 14.53.22.mov] 

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: On a business (JWM) project, list columns cannot be moved and re-ordered correctly if there are custom fields added

fields.description: The customer would like to have the availability to change the timeline colors in business projects, the same way as the banner or background colors.
fields.summary: Allow the customization of the timeline color in business projects.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When loading a board with a lot of fields and issue types the page becomes unresponsive for a few seconds.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
You go to a project with a lot of fields and issue types and in less than 10 seconds the screen will freeze and then after 5 seconds, you will be able to use the board without any issues. 

h3. Expected Results
The performance should not have any impact
h3. Actual Results
the screen will freeze and then after 5 seconds, you will be able to use the board without any issues. 


h3. Workaround
The current workaround is just removing issue types & fields from the project that are not used.
fields.summary: Performance impact when boards have a lot of fields and issue types.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Moving issues in Business project Board View allows invalid transitions, the issue remains in the invalid column but does not change the status.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Move the issue to the column with an invalid transition
 # Issue will remain in that column but it will not change status.
 # Once the Board page is refreshed the issue will move back to its original status column

h3. Expected Results

The issue once moved to the invalid column should be bounced back to the original column.
h3. Actual Results

The issue will remain in that column but it will not change status. Once the Board page is refreshed the issue will move back to its original status column.

No errors in Splunk logs.
 HAR file. [^JWMCLOUD-118.har]
 Video recording of the issue. [^Screen Recording 2021-10-12 at 09.59.21.mov] 
 Workflow of the board.
 !Screen Shot 2021-10-12 at 10.01.05.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Moving issues in Business project Board View allows invalid transitions

fields.description: I'd like to change the default labels on Form Builder, and use the tool on the Software side as well.
fields.summary: Ability to edit Form Builder

fields.description:
Currently, the issues on the JWM board can be filtered through the assignee. 
Filtering in List, Timeline, and Calendar Views have multiple options to filter issues. It would be nice to include those options in the Board filter too.

Filter in List View:

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

Filter in Board View:

 !Board View.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Add more filter options for JWM boards

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If a customer sets the default value of a multi-line text field as JSON (can be as simple as `{}`) issue create in all JWM views, it will fail to create the issue.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set the default value of a multi-line custom field with a JSON
 # Try to create an issue in a Jira Work Management project using the Form feature

h3. Expected Results

The issue should be created if all mandatory fields are filled.
h3. Actual Results

An error "Something's gone wrong" is displayed regardless of the field being present in the Form or Issue Create screen.

!image-2021-10-01-10-15-51-012.png|width=305,height=81!

The browser logs the following error:
{code:java}
{
  "sentFrom": "jira.frontend.jira-business.form.services.create-issue",
  "message": "Some fields were unexpectedly not returned properly",
  "event": {},
  "buildKey": "JF-PROD-25805",
  "logTime": "2021-09-17T19:42:42.653Z",
  "browserName": "Chrome",
  "browserVersion": "93.0"
}
{code}
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Having a JSON as the default custom field value throws an error when creating JWM issues

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Business project icons for an issue type *Epic* is not displayed correctly on the board. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a business project.
 # Add the issue type *Epic* to the project.
 # Create an issue type *Epic* and *task*.
 # Check the icons on the board.

h3. Expected Results

- Icons for different issues types to be displayed correctly on the board. 
h3. Actual Results

!image-2021-10-01-11-52-20-529.png!

!image-2021-10-01-11-52-43-143.png|thumbnail! 

!image-2021-10-01-11-52-49-908.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behaviour.
fields.summary: Business project icons displaying incorrectly

fields.description:
h3. Problem Statement

Spotlights are shown in Jira Work Management projects Timeline multiple times, even for users who have already saw this.
h3. Expected Results

The spotlights should be shown only at the first time one user access Timeline or, alternatively, the user should be able to disable his notifications through a "Dismiss" option.
h3. Actual Results

The warning are shown every time the user access Timeline feature.
fields.summary: Add "Dismiss" button to Timeline spotlights in Jira Work Management projects

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In the *Timeline* or *Calendar* when the *Filter* is applied it does not refresh the *Fitler* list to show what Filter is applied unless refresh the page once or twice.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to *Timeline* or *Calendar* 
 # Select *Filter* from the top right-hand corner
 # *Filter by* one of the available fields and *Apply*
 #  Open *Filter* again 

h3. Expected Results

To show what is filtered on
h3. Actual Results

It does not show what you have filtered on
h3. Workaround

Refresh the page once or twice to show *Filters Applied*
fields.summary: In the Timeline or Calendar when the Filter is applied it does not refresh the Fitler list to show what Filter is applied unless refresh the page once or twice.

fields.description:
I can already see tasks nested in stories, which is great.

Using Epics in Business projects help having a additional level to structure tasks proberly. 
Unfortunatelly this does not work out yet and I could not find a Ticket reffering to this topic. 

!image-2021-09-22-14-42-44-104.png!
fields.summary: Nest realted Tickets in Timeline (Epics > Stories > Tasks)

fields.description:
The primary way to navigate when browsing projects is through the "Projects" menu. 
In the menu I can pin my favorite projects (the recently opened projects are also displayed). 

As a result, I have links to several projects available. But unfortunately, with as many as 53 projects at the moment, such a narrow list of links is of little use when I want to supervise the work at random in all projects. 

I need the fastest possible way to go to my chosen project. 
I am currently searching projects via: 
1) Expanding the "Projects" menu, 
2) Selecting "View all projects" 
3) Going to the search field (a few typed letters allow me to quickly locate the project I am looking for). 

I would like to propose to reduce the number of steps needed to find a project by eliminating step "2". 
The search field (present in the upper left corner after selecting "wiew all projects") could already be available in the drop-down list "projects". 
After expanding this menu, the cursor should automatically appear in this field, allowing you to enter the searched phrase from the keyboard.
fields.summary: "Procects" dropdown menu with "keyword search"

fields.description: Adding Issue type icons to the board view would greatly improve the high-level overview of the Board View.
fields.summary: Add Issue Type Icons to the Board View

fields.description: Adding daily and weekly views to the calendar would greatly help improve usability, especially when a large number of issues appears on the same day
fields.summary: Add Additional Views - Daily/Weekly
